skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL Anthropic skill containing only brand guidelines documentation (colors, typography, fonts). No executable code, scripts, or security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Automatically applies Anthropic's official brand colors, typography, and visual identity to your documents and presentations for consistent, professional styling.
actual_capabilities: Applies Anthropic's official color palette (dark, light, gray, orange, blue, green)
Automatically styles headings with Poppins font (24pt+)
Applies Lora font to body text with fallbacks
Uses accent colors for shapes and visual elements
Smart color selection based on background contrast
Works with python-pptx for PowerPoint presentations
limitations: Requires Poppins and Lora fonts installed for best results (falls back to Arial/Georgia)
Designed specifically for Anthropic's brand - not customizable for other brands
Primarily focused on text and shape styling
Best suited for PowerPoint presentations via python-pptx
Does not include logo files or image assets

output_examples.input: What fonts should I use for headings in an Anthropic presentation?
output_examples.output: Use Poppins font for headings (24pt and larger) with Arial as a fallback. This is Anthropic's official heading font that maintains brand consistency.
Anthropic's primary accent color is Orange (#d97757 / RGB 217, 119, 87). Secondary accents are Blue (#6a9bcc) and Green (#788c5d).

best_practices: Install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment before using this skill for optimal results
Use the Dark color (#141413) for primary text on light backgrounds
Apply Orange accent (#d97757) for primary call-to-action elements
Maintain text hierarchy by using Poppins for headings and Lora for body text
Use Light Gray (#e8e6dc) for subtle backgrounds that need minimal contrast
Cycle through accent colors (orange, blue, green) for visual variety while staying on-brand
anti_patterns: Don't mix custom colors outside the official palette - it breaks brand consistency
Avoid using body fonts for headings or vice versa
Don't ignore fallback fonts - they ensure readability when custom fonts are unavailable
Don't use accent colors for body text - reserve them for emphasis and shapes
Avoid low-contrast combinations like Mid Gray text on Light Gray backgrounds

faq.question: What if I don't have Poppins or Lora fonts installed?
faq.answer: The skill automatically falls back to Arial for headings and Georgia for body text. However, for best brand consistency, install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment.

faq.question: Can I customize these brand colors for my own organization?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for Anthropic's brand identity. The colors and typography are fixed to maintain brand consistency.

faq.question: What file formats does this work with?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for PowerPoint presentations using python-pptx. It applies RGB color values and font styling through this library.

faq.question: When should I use each accent color?
faq.answer: Orange (#d97757) is the primary accent for key elements, Blue (#6a9bcc) for secondary accents, and Green (#788c5d) for tertiary accents. The skill cycles through them automatically for shapes.

faq.question: How do I know which text color to use?
faq.answer: Use Dark (#141413) for text on light backgrounds and Light (#faf9f5) for text on dark backgrounds. The skill applies smart color selection based on background contrast.

permissions: File system access for reading/writing presentation files
